heading: watershed for digital music
subheading: the music industry's standard for safeguarding digital music against piracy is complete and awaiting final approval. detractors still think it's an industry power grab. by oscar s. cisneros.
author: oscar s. cisneros
text: a coalition of more than 100 music business companies and groups said monday they had completed work on a new standard designed to place online music distribution back in the hands of industry. the specification, developed by the secure digital music initiative (sdmi), is a blueprint for consumer electronics manufacturers and software engineers. when built into music playback devices and software, it will limit the number of times digital music can be copied.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
